section.title: Adding a RADOS Gateway Node
section.para: During your initial installation and deployment, if you defined a dedicated cluster for the Ceph RADOS gateway component then these steps can be used to add additional Ceph RADOS gateway nodes.
You can install RADOS Gateway service in either of the following modes:

listitem.para: On (dedicated) cluster node(s) that host Ceph Monitor service

section.title: Prerequisite
section.para: You should have one or more bare-metal servers that meet the minimum hardware requirements for a RADOS gateway node which are documented in the .

section.title: Adding a RADOS Gateway Node on Dedicated Cluster Nodes
section.para: When RADOS Gateway is installed in this mode, a new RADOS Gateway node can be added to the Ceph cluster by executing the steps outlined in .

section.title: Adding a RADOS Gateway Node On (Dedicated) Cluster Node(s) that Host Ceph Monitor Service
section.para: When RADOS Gateway is installed in this mode, it is co-hosted with Ceph Monitor, adding a new RADOS Gateway node will also result in addition of a Ceph Monitor (which will violate the recommendation of maintaining odd number of monitors in a cluster). Therefore, in this mode it is recommended to add 2 nodes of this type at a time. Perform the steps outlined in .

section.title: Adding a RADOS Gateway Node on Controller Nodes
section.para: When RADOS Gateway is already installed in this mode, a new RADOS Gateway node cannot be added to an existing Ceph cluster.
Perform the following procedure to add RADOS Gateway Node:

procedure.title: Procedure to add RADOS Gateway Node

step.para: Log in to your lifecycle manager.

Edit your input model ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file to include the Ceph RADOS Gateway nodes. Copy and paste the section for an existing server having the RGW-ROLE role (if on dedicated cluster node) or MON-ROLE (if co-hosted on a Monitor cluster node) and edit the values to match the new server being added.

Verify the control_plane.yml file to check the values for member-count, min-count, and max-count, if you specified them, to ensure that they match up with your new total node count. For example, if you had previously specified member-count: 3 and are adding a fourth Ceph RADOS Gateway node, you will need to change that value to member-count: 4.

step.screen: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>"

step.para: Add the new node into Cobbler:
Reimage the new node as follows:
step.screen: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml -e nodelist=<node name>

step.para: Run the following playbooks to complete the deployment of your additional Ceph RADOS Gateway node and to reconfigure the HAProxy on the controller nodes:
step.screen: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --tags "generate_hosts_file" ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --limit <new-radosgw-hostname>,<controller1>,<controller2>,<controller3>
